result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvin Lamont Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (10 Days +), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-DNA sample.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: of Conviction (DOC-37) - extends probation for one year to 07/05/2019

1:02 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Paul Hasenstab present in court via telephone.  Court questions defendant regarding payment of court obligations.  Statement by defendant - needed to pay his electric bill, as it got quite high over the winter.  Statement by Agent Hasenstab.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court grants the defendant 90 days to pay off, til the end of August.  Court orders the defendant to spend 10 days in jail for each month unless the defendant has paid at least $60.00 starting in September.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  

Court adjourned at 1:08 p.m.
Probation review hearing on June 18, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

1:29 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Dawn Lokken present in court via telephone.  Statement by defendant - concurs, has not paid any monies and states reasons.  Agent Stockwell concurs, defendant was lost in the system.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of one year.  Court instructs the defendant that if probation is extended again, the court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:32 p.m.

Per Judge, ok to collect all the monies.  See Additional Financial Information.

records.addlTxt:
1:46 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 and counts 2 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by Bob Dore.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

SWD and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-100 hours of community service.
-DNA sample.
